meanings.definition: The quality or state of being protective.
meanings.sent1: Her protectivenesses towards her younger siblings was evident in how she always made sure they were safe.
meanings.sent2: The protectivenesses of a mother bear towards her cubs is well-known in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The protectivenesses of the guard dog extended even to the mailman, who he barked at every morning.
meanings.sent4: His protectivenesses over his vintage car was akin to a dragon guarding its treasure.
meanings.sent5: The protectivenesses of the castle walls kept the kingdom safe from invaders for centuries.

meanings.definition: The act of protecting or defending.
meanings.sent1: The protectivenesses of the security team ensured the event went smoothly without any disruptions.
meanings.sent2: In times of danger, the protectivenesses of the knights were crucial in safeguarding the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The protectivenesses of the umbrella during the storm was comical as it flipped inside out.
meanings.sent4: The protectivenesses of the shield around the warrior was like a barrier against all harm.
meanings.sent5: The protectivenesses of the fortress kept the valuable artifacts safe from thieves.
